channel.title: Hey guys some help
channel.description:
Hey guys..
well basically I really want to host my 667 , I really like the high detail and all that.. Please dont be cocky on me and say go back to 317 I really want to improve I've searched half google and I couldn't find the right answer so please could someone help me...
It's about the Ip of the client , I can join it but others can't..
Please someone help ?

item.title: Hey guys some help
item.dc:creator: @thakillah thakillah
item.description:
@thakillah wrote:

go to client.java in your client then ahear for 127.0.0.0 change it to your n-ip/vps ip then go to laoder.java in your client then do the same gl mate

Read full topic

item.title: Hey guys some help
item.dc:creator: @Keyal Keyal
item.description:
@Keyal wrote:

[quote=“Code kai, post:5, topic:445860”][quote author=Keyal link=topic=548721.msg4022404#msg4022404 date=1340115086]

Make sure:

…in client class, client sided.

Your gui.java or egui.java should remain as 0.0.0.0 as it should still host from your own computer and connect your players’
computers when they login.

Other possible issues:

  • Portforwarded correctly? Go to www.canyouseeme. (org) without the parenthesis to check the port ‘43594’
  • Is your firewall turned off?
  • Does your run.bat on server sided listen on the port 0.0.0.0 at 43594?
    [/quote] In the loader.java the public string = my no-ip right. and How can I see if my run.bait ( server sided listens on the port 0.0.0.0 and also I don’t have a egui or gui thanks for the positive feedback

I’m assuming you’re using a PI correct?[/quote]It’s a 667.Used to host a PI
I put everything to my no-ip and other still cant join… can someone please teamview me or something coz id really like to host this but It’s not working would love if someone could help me :o

Read full topic

item.title: Hey guys some help

Make sure:

Your gui.java or egui.java should remain as 0.0.0.0 as it should still host from your own computer and connect your players’
computers when they login.

Other possible issues:

  • Portforwarded correctly? Go to www.canyouseeme. (org) without the parenthesis to check the port ‘43594’
  • Is your firewall turned off?
  • Does your run.bat on server sided listen on the port 0.0.0.0 at 43594?
    [/quote] In the loader.java the public string = my no-ip right. and How can I see if my run.bait ( server sided listens on the port 0.0.0.0 and also I don’t have a egui or gui thanks for the positive feedback :)[/quote]

I’m assuming you’re using a PI correct?

Read full topic
